title: hippie fonts :)
content:
Hi does anyone have an advice about type faces that in some way can fit in a flower power concept but with out being to organic/jugend?  
Thanks...
author: stellan

comments.content:
One of these might do the trick: PAG Auto, PAG Bankas, Scentogram, Janice

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Personal Art and Design Portal of Ivan Gulkov  
 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720134636/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")
Thanks. I will check them out.

Jugend? I'm not sure what that means.

I've got a subfolder in my Decorative faces folder entitled 60's-70s-Spacey-Groovy.

I just took a look at the faces contained within and many of them might do the trick:

Amelia  
Bordeaux  
Cg Zeppelin  
Cruz Swinger  
Frigate  
Frigate Turkish  
Haulnhouse  
ITC Pioneer  
ITC Ronda  
Love  
Mojo Std  
Odessa  
Peace  
PopGroup  
Psych Smoke  
StonePla  
Turn Table PS  
Ziggy ITC  
Ziggy ITC

Hope that helps.

[http://typographyshop.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720134636/http:/typographyshop.com/ "http://typographyshop.com")  
 [http://kinggroupmedia.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720134636/http:/kinggroupmedia.com/ "http://kinggroupmedia.com")

Thanks a lot!  
Jugend = art nouveau

<cite>Jugend = art nouveau</cite>  
Not exactly, but close enough. I couldn't tell you the difference without looking through my art history references, though.
